first_reading.title: Letter to the Philippians
first_reading.text:
[[Ph 2,5]]Brothers and sisters: Have among yourselves the same attitude that is also yours in Christ Jesus,
[[Ph 2,6]]Who, though he was in the form of God, did not regard equality with God something to be grasped.
[[Ph 2,7]]Rather, he emptied himself, taking the form of a slave, coming in human likeness; and found human in appearance,
[[Ph 2,8]]he humbled himself, becoming obedient to death, even death on a cross.
[[Ph 2,9]]Because of this, God greatly exalted him and bestowed on him the name that is above every name,
[[Ph 2,10]]that at the name of Jesus every knee should bend, of those in heaven and on earth and under the earth,
[[Ph 2,11]]and every tongue confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
gospel.text:
[[Lc 14,15]]One of those at table with Jesus said to him, "Blessed is the one who will dine in the kingdom of God."
[[Lc 14,16]]He replied to him, "A man gave a great dinner to which he invited many.
[[Lc 14,17]]When the time for the dinner came, he dispatched his servant to say to those invited, 'Come, everything is now ready.'
[[Lc 14,18]]But one by one, they all began to excuse themselves. The first said to him, 'I have purchased a field and must go to examine it; I ask you, consider me excused.'
[[Lc 14,19]]And another said, 'I have purchased five yoke of oxen and am on my way to evaluate them; I ask you, consider me excused.'
[[Lc 14,20]]And another said, 'I have just married a woman, and therefore I cannot come.'
[[Lc 14,21]]The servant went and reported this to his master. Then the master of the house in a rage commanded his servant, 'Go out quickly into the streets and alleys of the town and bring in here the poor and the crippled, the blind and the lame.'
[[Lc 14,22]]The servant reported, 'Sir, your orders have been carried out and still there is room.'
[[Lc 14,23]]The master then ordered the servant, 'Go out to the highways and hedgerows and make people come in that my home may be filled.
[[Lc 14,24]]For, I tell you, none of those men who were invited will taste my dinner.'"

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 22,26b]]I will fulfill my vows before those who fear him.  
[[Ps 22,27]]The lowly shall eat their fill; 
They who seek the LORD shall praise him: 
"May your hearts be ever merry!"

[[Ps 22,28]]All the ends of the earth 
shall remember and turn to the LORD; 
All the families of the nations 
shall bow down before him.

[[Ps 22,29]]For dominion is the LORD's, 
and he rules the nations.
[[Ps 22,30a]]To him alone shall bow down 
all who sleep in the earth;

[[Ps 22,31]]And to him my soul shall live; 
my descendants shall serve him.
[[Ps 22,32]]Let the coming generation be told of the LORD 
that they may proclaim to a people yet to be born 
the justice he has shown.
